snippet: A series of secret nighttime flights over the last two months has brought the administration closer to meeting the president’s promise to empty the military prison in Cuba.
abstract: Pentagon memo; Obama administration is advancing toward president's goal of emptying military prison at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, with number of secret night flights over past two months; 127 prisoners are at prison currently, down from 680 in 2003, and two more groups of prisoners are poised to be released.
lead_paragraph: A series of secret nighttime flights over the last two months has brought the administration closer to meeting the president’s promise to empty the military prison in Cuba.

headline.print_headline: Obama Nears Goal for Guantánamo With Faster Pace of Releases
headline.main: Obama Nears Goal for Guantánamo With Faster Pace of Releases

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
